title: 112_hr1447
content: The Act may be cited as the "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012". It establishes the Aviation Security Advisory Committee. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee is established under the Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012. It advises the Assistant Secretary on aviation security matters and helps in the development and implementation of policies, programs, rulemaking, and security directives related to aviation security. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee develops recommendations for improvements to aviation security at the request of the Assistant Secretary. Working groups' recommendations must be approved by the Advisory Committee for transmission to the Assistant Secretary. The Committee periodically submits reports to the Assistant Secretary. The Advisory Committee submits reports to the Assistant Secretary on matters identified by the Assistant Secretary or a majority of its members. An annual report detailing activities, findings, and recommendations is also provided. Membership appointments must be made within 180 days. The Advisory Committee, appointed by the Assistant Secretary within 180 days, consists of representatives from up to 27 member organizations, including air carriers, all cargo air transportation, indirect air carriers, and labor. The Advisory Committee consists of representatives from various organizations in the aviation industry, including air carriers, indirect air carriers, labor organizations, aircraft manufacturers, airport operators, general aviation, privacy, the travel industry, and aviation technology security industry. Members may be removed for cause, and they do not receive compensation from the government for their service. The Advisory Committee meets regularly and may have additional meetings as needed. The Assistant Secretary will establish an air cargo security working group within the Committee to provide recommendations on air cargo security issues. The Transportation Security Administration established a working group to screen air cargo on passenger and all-cargo aircraft. The group meets quarterly to provide recommendations on air cargo security to the Advisory Committee for inclusion in the annual report. The submissions include suggestions to enhance cargo security initiatives in compliance with section 44901(g). The Assistant Secretary established a general aviation security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on transportation security issues for general aviation facilities, aircraft, and helicopter operations at airports. The group includes members with expertise in air cargo operations and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. The working group established by the Assistant Secretary focuses on aviation security at general aviation airports, with meetings held quarterly to provide recommendations to the Advisory Committee. The group includes members with expertise in general aviation and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Assistant Secretary has established a perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on airport perimeter security and access control issues. The group meets quarterly and submits information to improve security procedures at commercial service and general aviation airports. The Advisory Committee has a working group focused on airport perimeter security and access control issues. The group includes members with expertise in these areas and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to the Advisory Committee or its working groups. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to airport security, including the Advisory Committee, annual report, Assistant Secretary, and perimeter security. The curr_chunk clarifies the definition of airport security to include measures to secure and prevent unauthorized access to an airport, its airfield, terminal, fence area, access gates, and controls. The curr_chunk states the passing of the Aviation Security Advisory Committee bill in the House of Representatives on June 28, 2012.
